intro: Oxydectes membranacea, commonly known as the membranous oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive membranous texture, contributing to its common name. Oxydectes membranacea is often grown for its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
